page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Because there is only a fortnightly bus service to the local market town of Halesworth, the majority of homes have at least 1 car, several 2. and a few a derelict vehicle as well. There are about 6 motor or motorized cycles and most households harbour at least 1 bicycle. A single pony & trap makes regular pleasure trips, but of the 30 or so horses none is used solely for transport. Tractors are used,particularly in the snow. In term time coaches take pupils daily to their primary, middle and high schools. Apart from these the most frequent heavy vehicles are milk, cattle , pig & corn lorries servicing the farms. Indee, the only vehicles on the road are those which have a business or social interest in the village as the unclassified road leads nowhere.
